events.title: Elizabeth I becomes Queen of England
events.description: Elizabeth I ascended to the English throne following the death of her half-sister Mary I, beginning a reign known as the Elizabethan era.
events.significance: Her reign saw the flourishing of English drama, the defeat of the Spanish Armada, and the establishment of Protestantism in England.

events.title: Opening of the Suez Canal
events.description: The Suez Canal officially opened, connecting the Mediterranean Sea and the Red Sea, drastically reducing travel time between Europe and Asia.
events.significance: It revolutionized global trade routes and maritime travel.

events.title: Military coup in Chile
events.description: General Augusto Pinochet led a military coup overthrowing President Salvador Allende, establishing a military dictatorship.
events.significance: The coup led to widespread political repression and had long-lasting impacts on Chile's society and politics.

events.title: Velvet Revolution begins in Czechoslovakia
events.description: Students and dissidents gathered in Prague to protest communist rule, sparking the Velvet Revolution.
events.significance: This non-violent revolution led to the end of communist rule in Czechoslovakia and the establishment of a democratic government.

events.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial dedicated
events.description: The Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial was dedicated in Washington, D.C., to honor the U.S. president who led the country through the Great Depression and World War II.
events.significance: The memorial recognizes Rooseveltâ€™s impact on American history and governance.
